Reviews.Title: “Quaint little hotel in great neighborhood”
Reviews.Author: Chris G
Reviews.Content: My 10 year old daughter and I recently visited NYC for the weekend and stayed at the Chelsea Lodge. It was perfect..walking distance to plenty of restaurants, coffee shops and Chelsea Piers (bowling alley, ice skating, rock wall, etc.). It was only a 10 minute cab ride from Grand Central Station too. This hotel had a cute and homey feel...more like a bed and breakfast (without the pricetag!). Very clean with a private shower, sink and toilet in our suite. I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “A good location, but noisy, poor quality accomodation.”
Reviews.Author: Finwiz32
Reviews.Content: Stayed 4 nights in a Parlour Suite, having seen a recommendation in the UK Sunday Telegraph. The location was very convenient for the subway, nearby shops and restaurants and a few blocks away from 5th Avenue and the Empire State Building. The suite took the form of a spacious room, adjacent to the street, which had been sub-divided to include a bathroom with a highly dangerous shower head, difficult to control, and a reasonably equipped, small kitchen. Our main concern was the noise factor combined with a very hard bed under the window on the street side. Traffic noise was continuous till past midnight, then started up again in the early hours. In addition, there was noise from renovation work being carried out on the church, immediately next door. The suite was reasonably clean, with some "interesting abstract art work" on the walls, but the area was jaded and in serious need of attention to bring it up to a reasonable standard. In particular, the decoration of the entrance area left a lot to be desired!!

Reviews.Title: “Nice location but poor accomodation”
Reviews.Author: neoluk
Reviews.Content: A nice place in the heart of Chelsea. The hotel is in a nice three floors building in a quiet street. The rooms are very small and do not have toilet but only the sink and the shower. I agree with the reviews talking about a non satisfying sleep quality of the room: the bed is not particularly big and the heating runs mostly in the night sending a flow of hot air just behind your heads. Breakfast is not available so you have to eat every morning in one of the several coffee shops or restaurants in the contiguous 8th Avenue. In the end, finding an apartment to rent in the same are can be a bit more expensive but worth it.

Reviews.Title: “Mixed views about our stay”
Reviews.Author: alanadi25
Reviews.Content: We have mixed reviews about our stay at Chelsea Lodge. I knew what to expect but my partner was very underwhelmed when we arrived and saw our room It was tiny with a double bed, no toilet (as I already knew) and a shower in our room. During the night we were both very hot and uncomfortable, there was no way (that we knew of) to control the heat. The pipes made loud noise and in the morning it was very loud outside of our room in the lobby. People talking and walking up and down the stairs. The second night my partner was very sick from some seafood that he ate. We contemplated leaving the hotel as he was sick and uncomfortable, but we stayed and left first thing in the morning. Our stay was ok but I probably would not stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice location, good price but disappointed with sleep quality.”
Reviews.Author: BradJill
Reviews.Content: We stayed 4 nights in Chelsea Lodge during winter. Reservations were made through their website, 5 months in advance. Location: Nondescript brownstone building in a tree-lined neighborhood, with a local NY feel to staying here. There are no signs for the lodge so just trust that you got the right address - "318" is on the right side of the doorway. The subway station is a few minutes walking distance with diners and grocery stores/pharmacies nearby. We arrived in the evening and check in was straightforward. No lifts so be prepared if you have heavy luggage. Luckily our room was on the 2/F. The stairs were creaky; not sure if this was additional noise in some rooms but it did not reach ours. Our first impression was that of a lovely room with adequate space (We had 1 luggage), and enough wardrobe space. No safe available, but we locked our valuables in our luggage with no problems. Shower took up to several minutes to turn warm, but otherwise ok. There are 2 shared toilets on the floor, they were always clean and we never had to wait to use them. Free wifi too. However we felt that the cons outweighed the pros. - The double bed sagged in the middle and we had to sleep near the edges of the bed. - The pipes in the room were noisy. - The room got unbearably hot at night. The heater, which was next to the window, turned off when we opened the window. Then it got too cold! So we woke up frequently at night, and never had a good night's sleep in Chelsea Lodge. Maybe, if at least the bed was comfortable we would consider returning, but with a chance of a sagging mattress (also reported by some TA travelers) we prefer to try elsewhere the next time we are in NYC. However New York is very expensive for accommodations so regardless of the flaws of Chelsea Lodge, this might still make a good option for those on a budget.

Reviews.Title: “Plumming noise!”
Reviews.Author: baianointheworld
Reviews.Content: I was in NYC for just 4 nights, and wanted something cheap but with a good location within Manhattan. After a thourough research here and in guide books I found out about Chelsea Lodge. I got the room with no WC, just shower and basin. The room was small, as I already expected. Wsuitcases, one big and another mid sized, and we could go on around the room if we managed to organize things beforehand. NYC is very expensive, and the room cost USD 147 with tax. The location in good, with good access to a Subway Station. What bothered me was the plumming. Out of the blue it started making a great noise, like if someone was banging the pipes, and the noise was pretty high! I had to sleep with ear plugs, otherwise I would keep getting awake all night (this happend on the first night).

Reviews.Title: “I'd stay again, if on a short trip.”
Reviews.Author: ftnz
Reviews.Content: Chelsea Lodge is located within walking distance of Penn Station, which is one of the main reasons I chose it. A good pick indeed, as I was able to get out and about to everything I wanted to see with ease. The rooms are small, so I don't think you would want to stay longer than a few nights, but I knew that before booking. I found everything to be clean too. CL customer service extends to having a person near the front desk who takes your money and gives you a key - very transactional, and not going to win any awards here for friendliness. Also, I'm not convinced about the whole "character" thing, personally I think it is all rather old and needs some money pumped into for new wallpaper etc. Overall, I would stay here again though, but only if it were for a few days.

Reviews.Title: “2 major problems”
Reviews.Author: Southerncross3777
Reviews.Content: Stayed 3 nights and although it was conveniently located and we loved the location the bed was as hard as a rock and the shared toilet stank of urine and I had to clean it myself a few times. We stayed on the ground floor. Wouldn't recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “good value”
Reviews.Author: Gristy58
Reviews.Content: stayes five nights here and was the cheapest place i couls find. room was small but manageble. free wifi and sweets on the frony desk. the heating broke the last night.but.there were guys fixing it when we left. only three blocks walk from the ACE lines and two stops from times sq.

Reviews.Title: “Good value, good location”
Reviews.Author: sendtofrank
Reviews.Content: We stayed here based on the bulk of other reviews and our needs for our 12 day stay in New York City. The room was small yet comfortable as we only used it for sleeping after spending all of our time out and about. I would recommend this accommodation for those budget minded and basically wanted a bed whilst in New York City. It is well located to transport, restaurants and grocery stores.

Reviews.Title: “good place especially for going to Chelsea galleries”
Reviews.Author: Knucklesmccarthy
Reviews.Content: Great place, clean friendly. As long as you do not mind stairs it is one of the best values in NCY.

Reviews.Title: “comfy and cozy in new york city”
Reviews.Author: sushiskynyc
Reviews.Content: we have stayed before at this hotel. this time we had a room with private bath. next time the studio which is a mini apartment. we will bring our grandsons. great neighborhood. we have lived in new york and this is the best way to have the feeling of really being in new york. the room was comfy, warm and cozy. clean towels every day and they make the bed up. no daily linen service.

Reviews.Title: “Another great stay”
Reviews.Author: ozzietravelers
Reviews.Content: This is our second stay, accomodations are basic but for what you are paying great value. We stayed in 1a last time and 3a this time both rooms were pretty much identical. They had a double bed, small shower, basin, desk and chest of draws. The Toilet is down the hall, on levels 2 & 3 there are 2 toilets. There is no Elevator so you do have to climb the stairs. Internet strength upstairs is a little hit and miss. The rooms were cleaned each morning with fresh towels. The hotel is very quiet and in a great location. The Subway 1,2,3 and A,C,E lines are only a couple of blocks away. Its a 5min walk to Chelsea Market and a 20-25 min walk to Times Square. We would definately stay here again. We have heard 2a is a slightly bigger room but can not confirm this.

Reviews.Title: “Cold service”
Reviews.Author: Aussie_Day_Tripper
Reviews.Content: Chose this lodge for the location and price - these 2 factors combined can't be beat. However I would consider paying more in return for better standards of service. The front desk was too cool and didn't offer any information or assistance. It seemed like they were more interested in office work on the computer than taking care of guests. This place was like staying at grandma's house, with a sagging bed mattress that needs replacing and old bed linen. The housekeepers were also quite noisy in the mornings, talking loudly to each other across the hallway.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: Melby
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Chelsea Lodge for 14 nights. The room was tiny, but clean and comfortable. I mean we only paid US $140.00 a night. That is so inexpensive for New York. We were hardly in our room at all. The shared toilets were never a problem, they were always clean. The money we saved on accommodation allowed us to eat at the most gorgeous restaurants in the area and surrounding areas. Chelsea is really central and has so many dining and bar options to choose from. I would definitely stay at the Chelsea Lodge again.

Reviews.Title: “Don't Seem To Care”
Reviews.Author: donnolan
Reviews.Content: The management at the Chelsea Lodge do not seem to care very much about their place or their guests. My wife and I stayed for two nights in a "suite" in September, 2011. The suite had that rundown, sort of first apartment thrown together look to it. On the positive side, there was a lot of room, the bed was good, the flat screen tv was fine, the shower was decent and, apart from the incredibly loud air-conditioner, there was no problem with noise. So the essentials were okay, except that the internet connection in the room didn't work. The problem was that, apart from a younger guy named Mike, who checked us in, no one acted like he really gave a flip. For example, our room wasn't made up during our stay. Not really a big deal, but certainly below the standards of the hospitality industry. When I returned the key during checkout, the crusty older man who took it checked to see if I had paid. When he saw I had, he said, "Okay". That's it. Would a "thank you" have hurt him? Again, it's not that big of a deal. My delicate sensibility withstood the slight. And, after all, I was "only" paying $229 per night, so benign neglect was all I could expect. I get it. Okay. As I was leaving, a gentleman from, I think, the UK was mildly complaining that the refrigerator in his suite was "absolutely filthy". Good luck. 2 and a half stars. Below the standard. I won't go back.

Reviews.Title: “NYC sized, budget friendly and adequate”
Reviews.Author: Basasusa
Reviews.Content: I travelled with my cousin/ good friend on the vacation we'd been talking about for years. After doing a ton of research, we decided to go with Chelsea Lodge mainly based on the price and favorable reviews. The Chelsea Lodge was established in 1999 and I doubt much has changed since those renos. Each floor has about 7 rooms and 2 washrooms (toilet and sink). The main floor has fewer rooms and just a toilet with hand sanitizer on the wall. Each room also has it's own sink and shower. I had read that the rooms were small and yes, they are. The beds are a double/ full size and ours was against one wall. There was also a dresser in our room. We could both have our suitcases open in our room, and leave a path for walking around the bed to the sink but that was it. The small space really was not an issue because we were out most of the time (not hanging around our hotel room) and face it: most of Manhattan is super crowded. There was a wireless router on our floor but because our room was in the back, where the hallway curved, we could not pick up a signal in our room and had to stand on the landing, the hallway or go down to the lobby to use wireless the most comfortably. I assume the rooms closer to the router, not around a bendy hallway were ok with the internet. One thing no reviewer had mentioned is that the daily cleaners use very scented products in every facet of cleaning. I work in a hospital and am used to a no scent policy. The cleaners used pine sol and scented baking soda for the carpet before vacuuming. I saw one often use a can of glade and give a room a strong burst of scent just before she finished cleaning and closed the door. I would have to say, if you are scent sensitive or have allergies or asthma, you probably do not want to stay here. One other thing is that the washrooms are not soundproof. In the hallway, I could definitely hear people doing their business. Be aware of this. In all, I am very much in agreement that Chelsea Lodge is a great value! Small, but more than adequate for people who want to see the city!

Reviews.Title: “Small but clean and comfortable.”
Reviews.Author: MustG0
Reviews.Content: We stayed in NYC at the beginning of September to enjoy the city and sites. I loved this area of town. Chelsea seems like a great neighborhood close to the West Village which I loved more. It was a quiet street close to great amenities. There was a delicious coffee shop called Cafe Grumpy a few blocks away that has great espresso and coffee. The subway was very close and so was the High Line. (look it up) We stayed in a regular room not a suite. The room was very small but it was nice to have a shower and sink in the room. There were two toilets on our floor to be shared. They were never being used when I needed it. It would not be the type of room to stay in if you want to lounge around. It is perfect for those who want a place to sleep and shower but are planning on spending most of their time exploring the city. I would stay here again if I were planning another trip to NYC for just a few days. Staying here for more than a few days may be too cramped. If I were a solo traveler, I could stay in this room longer. For 2 people it can feel crowded with luggage etc. Also, it was very hot and muggy when we visited and the window A/C kept our room nice and cool.

Reviews.Title: “Like in movies”
Reviews.Author: Kozengaf
Reviews.Content: We spent in the hotel 5 nights. Generally we were very satisfied. 1) People at front deck were very kind and helped every time we needed help. For example, we arrived 6 houres before check in, left all the bags in the front deck room and went to explore the city. When we returned, our luggage was already in the room. That was vey kind, keeping in mind that our room was on the third floor and there is no elevator in the building. 2) Rooms. They are like old movies like Blues Brothers - very very tiny))) but unlike in the movies clean, comfortable and no railwayroads)))) Seriously, rooms are very small, we could hardly find plays for two bags. Shower is in the room and has transparent matte doors. The bathroom is in the corridor. Two bathroom per floor. Don't think it is a problem: we never coinsided with enyone. 3) Beds are comfortable, airconditioner is good, but in our room it was located just over our heads, so we had to turn it off at night. But in the other room it was ok. 4) Rooms are cleaned every day. 5) The location of the hotel is very good. It is 30-40 minutes walking from the Times Square or 7-9 dollars taxi-ride. 6) There are a lot cafes near the hotel, so it is no problem to find a place to have a meal. But generally we liked the hotel. And can recomend it to others.

Reviews.Title: “Overrated”
Reviews.Author: ciba74
Reviews.Content: I spent 2 nights in Chelsea Lodge based on a friend advice and confirmed by TA ratings. My final comment for this hotel is positive, very convenient and strategic position for best areas visiting in NYC, though I think it is generally overrated. First of all the price: I am somewhat surprised to see so many favourable comments about economic competitiveness of this lodge: You are having extra-small room (ours was also very dark with a single window facing a wall) with private micro-basin and shower, shared bathroom at floor, and you're paying tax included 160$ per night... Not so cheap. Ok, it's NYC and you are closed to the Meatpacking District, in Chelsea... but i'm used to smart booking sites that offer much better rates for an higher star level, even in NYC. Secondly the service: everybody is entusiastic... Well, we recieved a cold welcome, very quick and not extremely polite! We've been given instructions and tips, but in many other places I think I got a much warmer and accomodating impression at the front desk. Besides be prepaired to experience all the drawbacks of a small lodge: e.g. after the first night we woke up at 11 am, being very tired from the previous day. Housekeeping is managed by a single person and most likely after 11 am she's off duty, so we did not have the room done. Btw the hotel is very clean.... Finally my opinion is that the coziness and the wonderful location of the Lodge do not balance the extremely small space of the rooms, the bath sharing, and the mid-range service offered. I recommend you spend few bucks more (or even less!) and get a 3-star Hotel in Madison Square Garden/Times Sqaure.

Reviews.Title: “way better than expected”
Reviews.Author: atomiumBXL
Reviews.Content: Having been to NY before in a more expensive hotel, but this time on a budget, we weren't so sure what to expect. Coming from JFK airport, the shuttle didn't even want to go to West 20th, said he was 'limited' to 25th. After negociation he would drop us in front of Chelsea Lodge after all. It's in a charming, relatively quiet street with trees. In a safe neighborhood near the gay community, which was not a problem for my gfirlfriend and I. If you're homophobic then you may want to avoid the area. But we found the people very friendly. Then we entered the building. First impression was the smell of... clean laundry. I like it. The lady at the desk gave us the keys. The room, upstairs, was just what we needed. Small but clean and comfortable. It has a shower cabin and a sink inside the room, and paintings of ancient america's settlers. There were two toilets in the corridor, which are cleaned regularly and were never occupied. The staff is distant but friendly when approached. There are many (asian, italian) restaurants, a supermarket at the corner, and murray's bagels for breakfast. Can't beat that. The subway is one a half blocks away. Conclusion: Why pay more? Chelsea Lodge's got all you need for a wonderful stay in NYC.

Reviews.Title: “Charming place; excellent location”
Reviews.Author: infoispower
Reviews.Content: This hotel is on the west side in Chelsea. Delightful, shady tree-lined street within walking distance of many lovely buildings. Also nearby Chelsea Market (must see, great food choices) and The High Line (great park, stunning views). Excellent Thai restaurant 1/2 a block away, Starbucks, of course, and a big pharmacy also half a block away. Staff at the hotel very courteous, hotel very clean.

Reviews.Title: “Easily the best bargain stay in NYC”
Reviews.Author: NuMystic
Reviews.Content: Used Chelsea Lodge on a whim for an overnight last weekend and it far exceeded our expectations. JosÃ© offered us a rate of $130 if we payed cash for a room that had it's own sink and shower, and shared toilet in the hall. Room was small but impeccably clean and with ice cold air conditioning. We actually had to turn it down after a bit. The hallways were sweltering, especially up on the third floor, but once inside the room it was blissfully cold. For only $20 than we've paid for the Carlton Arms in the past we got a room that is twice as nice and infinitely cleaner. Nicer neighborhood to boot. Have never been a fan of shared bathrooms, but the in room shower and sink completely takes care of everything we would want to do in privacy. Only going out for the toilet itself is much less of an inconvenience than we imagined it would be. This is now our official go-to spot for affordable stays in NYC

Reviews.Title: “Chelsea Lodge is a great option for those on a budget”
Reviews.Author: USAb0und
Reviews.Content: My sister and I stayed in the Chelsea Lodge on a recent trip to New York. I would highly recommend it to anyone looking for a small budget hotel in a good location. Rooms are small with one double bed so would be perfect for a couple or close friends or family. The shower is in the bedroom so not much privacy and the toilet it shared but this was never a problem. The 1st room we had was on the ground floor on the street side and there was quite a bit of street noise but the staff were very helpful and moved us to a much quieter room on the 2nd floor at the back of the hotel. The location is fantastic. Subway is less than 5 minutes walk away with quick access to midtown and downtown. There is free wifi in the lobby but we were able to access it in both the rooms we were in. Overall I'd really recommend the Chelsea Lodge if you're looking for nothing fancy but a great location and helpful staff.

Reviews.Title: “value for money”
Reviews.Author: feefeen0303
Reviews.Content: Well located hotel - price reasonable - staff helpful - happy to recommend this hotel

Reviews.Title: “Heard great things, but a little disappointed!”
Reviews.Author: rpmalone
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in a great spot. We took one of the suites. We are a young family travelling with two small children (a baby and a toddler). We had no help with our bags, on a baking hot day, which wouldn't matter so much excet that our suite was 30 yards down the street. We booked the suite over six months ago and asked for the garden suite. We were advised against this, but it turned out it would have suited us much better. But the thing that was very disappointing was the failure of the hotel to provide Wi-Fi! Here we are in one of the world's great city's and we're paying several hundred dollars for a family suite in 2011 and there is no internet facility, without leaving our building and traipsing down the street to the hotel lobby for Wi-Fi. Our disappointment was compounded when the hotel staff member on duty aggressively defended this lack of provision, making out it was a difficult thing to install! It left a bad taste in the mouth and for this reason I think the hotel was very overrated. Great part of town though and the rest of the staff was friendly. I think the staff member I referred too, did not like to hear differing views from his own and may have regretted his aggression. Not a good hotel for a family with small kids!

Reviews.Title: “I loved it so much I'm coming back”
Reviews.Author: FabioDias
Reviews.Content: I loved staying at Chelsea Lodge so much I'm coming back in a couple of months. This was my first time in NYC and the location was just PERFECT. About 10 blocks away from all the madness which was very accessible on foot and also a very relaxed and calm place to stay. The staff was very friendly and the hotel was clean and neat. The only downside was that we stayed on the 3rd floor and since you have to take the stairs, if you're carrying heavy luggage you need to work your way up and we also could not get wifi signal up on the 3rd floor which was a bummer. Aside from that we had a GREAT time at Chelsea Lodge. Very friendly staff and in my opinion the PERFECT location to stay in NYC - close enough to walk to the main attractions and far enough to be able to rest and enjoy the actual city life in Manhattan. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Love Chelsea lodge so much!”
Reviews.Author: AliceR006
Reviews.Content: We came here 3 years ago and was really worried it wouldn't be as good as we remembered but it didn't let us down! Love having a little shower in the perfectly decorated rooms and sharing the toilet is no problem. V helpful with booking us an early taxi back to the airport.

Reviews.Title: “Very good price/value”
Reviews.Author: scm98_de
Reviews.Content: We stayed three nights and we enjoyed it. The rooms are small and the toilet is on the floor, but that was no problem, because you have two toilets on each floor and the toilet was always very clean. The price is very reasonable for new york and truely spoken you won't stay very long in your room, if you stay in NY. You just need it for sleeping , so the room size wasn't so important for us. The next substation is 5 minutes away and you find several groceries and restaurants in the area around. I can recommend rub bby.

Reviews.Title: “I would stay here again”
Reviews.Author: Vallerina30
Reviews.Content: The Chelsea Lodge is in a great location, just a short walk from a subway. It's in a residential neighborhood so it's quiet at night as well. The staff was very helpful, and everything was clean. There are places to eat nearby as well. I was initially worried about the shared restroom facilities but there was never any wait and they were always clean. There are showers in each room though which is very convenient. The price is reasonable and I was pleased with my stay.

Reviews.Title: “Quiet, clean and cozy rooms”
Reviews.Author: CanadianTravelCat
Reviews.Content: This is a wonderful place to stay, in a great location. Lots of restaurants and the subway close by. The room was small, but it doesn't matter when you're really only there to sleep. It was very cozy and comfortable and I instantly felt right at home. The atmosphere is very charming, with unique decor. The staff were all very nice and helpful; we could keep our bags with the front desk after checking out, and the city/subway map provided with the room was very handy! The only downside, to be picky, was that the mattress was a bit soft, and the blinds were a bit dusty. The room was otherwise very clean, with fresh towels daily. The washroom was down the hall and shared, but it was impeccably clean and I never had to wait even though the place was fully booked. Don't let the shared washroom stop you from staying here! I will definintely stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Ideal for young couples, good location.”
Reviews.Author: Bomanda28
Reviews.Content: Chelsea Lodge is no thrills, yet at the same time it is quaint, clean and well looked after. It is in hip Chelsea and it makes getting round very easy. The share toilet was not an issue and the shower in the room is not as odd as it first sounds, however I would only recommend this set up for couples only.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice and cozy place to stay!”
Reviews.Author: Janaina M
Reviews.Content: We really had a nice time at the Lodge! The place is clean, smells good, itÂ´s quite, nice deco! The only little problem is that there is no toilet inside the bedroom but we never had to wait for it as it was always available! Besides all of that, Chelsea is a very nice neighborhood with cal streets and a restaurant at very corner!

Reviews.Title: “Great Find, awesome location! like staying at a family friend's”
Reviews.Author: Amyncarr
Reviews.Content: I would definitley reccomend this place. Rooms are small but clean and have everything you need. The cost is really reasonable and is a fraction of the price compared to those hotels 5-10 mins closer to the city centre. Close to everything including tube, great restaurants and convenience stores to grab a guick bagel or fruit salad as you wander down past madison square gardens and into time square to take in the delights of NY city. I would recommend the thai place just round the corner, its fab, you might want to book ahead, but its does great passionfruit bellinis and you have got to try the jade dumplings, they're amazing!

Reviews.Title: “loved the location”
Reviews.Author: sharroncarson
Reviews.Content: I really loved that this small guesthouse was in a residential type area. You were very close to all the iconic sights of New York and still able to walk out the front door and see people walking their dogs and going about their daily lives. Rooms tiny but serviceable and very clean. Very close to subway, great restaurants and cafes. Only a few blocks from the Chelsea market which I loved.

Reviews.Title: “Definitely recommended”
Reviews.Author: wwttrr_021
Reviews.Content: Cosy rooms, great location and very reasonably priced. I stayed for eight nights and slept well for every one of them. The rooms are small but perfectly sized for returning to after a day exploring the city.

Reviews.Title: “Super location and value in Chelsea”
Reviews.Author: brisbane21
Reviews.Content: Considering the price and quiet (but central) location, Chelsea Lodge is a great place to stay, especially for queer travellers wanting to make the most of the local scene. Subway access is good (23rd and 14th streets on 9th and 18th on 7th), and the West Village is a short walk away. With only 22 rooms you do need to book in advance however. Pros: â€¢ Great location on W20th between 8th and 9th avenue â€¢ Bars, restaurants, pharmacies, laundromats, gyms etc all close by â€¢ Lots of gay venues within walking distance â€¢ Excellent value (about $150 per night / double, incl taxes) â€¢ Free strong wi-fi â€¢ Good subway access â€¢ You can get a good night's sleep â€¢ Rooms cleaned daily â€¢ Helpful staff Cons: â€¢ Rooms rather small (the luggage rack and chest of drawers come in handy) â€¢ Showers are small and a little tricky to operate at first (easy to scald yourself!) â€¢ Toilets not in room, although they are very clean Quirks â€¢ Old school furnishings and photos around the place give a homely vibe â€¢ You can't book and pay online and they issue handwritten receipts Overall, a rather quaint place that deserves its high ratings. We'll definitely be back.

Reviews.Title: “Chelsea Lodge *Suites*”
Reviews.Author: bevzb
Reviews.Content: The suite was great! Very large room (especially by NY standards), very nice bathroom, kitchen with full refrig/freezer, stove, dishes, cutlery, cofffee maker. No microwave, but so what? Free wireless in lobby only, but there are plenty of Starbucks' around the area. The location is wonderful!!! I love this neighborhood and will definitely stay there again. Highly recommended!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value, great location”
Reviews.Author: Stranger2
Reviews.Content: Upside: Clean rooms, good service, great location, good waterpressure in shower, simple but nice room. And check out this: We had booked five nights at Chelse lodge but was delayed, and missed one night due to flight-trouble. The staff only charged us for four nights, not the no-show night!! THAT is good service!!! To sum it up: Excellent value compared to other offers on Manhattan, highly recommend it. Downside: Very small room and small bed. But its Manhattan... How much time do you really spend in your room? And about the toilet down the hall: Really not a problem if you're up for it. Not more than a couple of rooms shared the toilet so it was no problem for us. .

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic find in the heart of Chelsea”
Reviews.Author: Frances085
Reviews.Content: This was my fifth visit to New York but was the first time for my boyfriend and his parents so I wanted somewhere that was central, clean and affordable. Three things that don't usually go hand in hand in Manhattan! However Chelsea lodge fit the bill! In a fantastic location; 5 minutes to the Meatpacking district, 10 minutes to Greenwich Village and 15 minutes to Midtown this is a perfect spot for exploring the City, without having to cope with Midtown prices and crowds. The staff were helpful and made us feel welcome, even letting us store our bags there for a few hours. The rooms were compact but clean, with maid service pretty much every day. We stayed for 6 nights and I would definitely go back again the next time we visit the City.

Reviews.Title: “Great location. More money to shop!”
Reviews.Author: shefftrip
Reviews.Content: Chelsea Lodge is in a fabulous location within a 15 min walk of the flat iron building and 20 mins of the Empire State. Surrounded by a massive choice of places to eat and only three blocks from the subway (if you're not confident using the subway download the idiots guide from TripAdvisor). Our room was ample sized for a four night stay and there was a hanging rail and a place for suitcases too. Please don't be put off by there not being a loo in the room. We didn't have to wait once and also there are not enough rooms to cause an issue. The loos, rooms and hallways were really clean but there was a bit of dust on the high shelves (but not as much as at my house!) I loved the homely feel to the lodge and the staff were really helpful without being in your face. I also liked the fact that there wasn't a huge sign outside saying Chelsea Lodge. Just a big number so we did feel like locals! If staying at the Chelsea Lodge means the difference between being able to afford a stay in New York or not, then go for it! This place is like an English B and B but without the breakfast! Don't worry there are loads of places for breakfast - The Dish (peanut butter and banana pancakes), Murray's bagels (cream cheeses and smoked salmon on whatever bagels you want) and Cafe Grumpy (coffee and croissant). Save money on your room and spend it in the shops instead!

Reviews.Title: “For the price, a great budget-friendly place to stay in a fantastic location.”
Reviews.Author: DeanInMelbourne
Reviews.Content: My friend and I stayed here for 11 nights on our first visit to New York City, and were pleased with Chelsea Lodge's offerings and their competitive pricing. The staff members gave great first impressions, and we loved the cosy Americana feel this place has. The room, which was 'cosy' but still comfortable enough for the two of us, was tidy and as an added bonus was serviced daily with fresh towels and amenities. This is by no means state of the art accommodation, but you're in New York and there's a lot to do outside, so if luxury isn't your main concern this place should be on the top of your list. Chelsea is a great jumping off point - a short walk to the West Village and The Meatpacking District with great bars and eateries in the vicinity. It's a cheap cab or subway ride to other parts of Manhattan and Brooklyn. I wouldn't hesitate in giving this place the thumbs up for those looking for a reasonable priced place to stay in a great part of New York City.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely fabulous”
Reviews.Author: KM2Australia
Reviews.Content: We returned yesterday from an 8 day stay in NYC with my family of 6. We had a suite with access to the garden and one of the double rooms. We could not have been happier. The accomodation is extremely central (but in a neighborhood zone, not a tourist strip- a key requirement for us, as we wanted our children to develop an understanding of life as a New Yorker), safe, clean, QUIET and easily accessible to everything , including the wonderful Chelsea markets- coffee nearly as good as Melbourne coffee and Amy's breadshop is fantastic. We loved sitting on the steps of the Chelsea Lodge each morning and afternoon and watching life go by. The service was unobtrusive but available and helpful as required. Highly recommended and incredible value. I cannot imagine why the rating of this hotel is not higher on Trip Advisor

Reviews.Title: “my 60th birthday in nyc”
Reviews.Author: VictoriaBcValerie
Reviews.Content: I have spent about 4 birthdays in nyc. we stay at the chelsea lodge always. this time we were on the 3rd floor which was abit of a hike from front door steps to our room. about 78 step s. then again im getting old i guess. Yes the rooms are tiny but it doesnt matter. theres good beds and cute flat screen tvs, and hershey kisses on your pillow when you arrive. The bathroom is in the halland has always been clean and well stocked. It a pretty quiet place also. The location is very good. Theres a good mexican restaurant to the right up the street. and a good place like a caffateria to the left to have a good breakfast. you can not beat the price anywhere. Decor is great. jose has been there for a few yrs and is very nice and helpful. We will continue to stay there. Hope you enjoy it also. valerie

Reviews.Title: “Good choice to stay at NYC”
Reviews.Author: HongTao1991
Reviews.Content: Dear Paul and Tim, Chelsea Lodge is a good choice for the people - "Travel your own". It has all what you need - warm bath, good sleep, good location for commute, store and resturtant nearby. I should specially thank for Tim's help booking the car for us for our 6am flight to Orlando in the early morning. One small tip for traveler - consider to pay in cash instead of credit card; you should be able to get some small saving. Portia and Hong

Reviews.Title: “Very unpleasant”
Reviews.Author: oliver71_10
Reviews.Content: Fortunately we only stayed one night. All looked great from the publicity but it does not live up to the hype. The room was small but the bed was a nightmare. Hemmed up against a wall and you only had to look at it for it to creak...I barely slept a wink. The people were dour on the point of surly. On a positive point, the Htl is very well situated and they were good enough to look after our bags for a few hours.

Reviews.Title: “Felt like the old times”
Reviews.Author: Shinningstar0214
Reviews.Content: After reading the reviews I decided to book a three night stay at Chelsea Lodge. Being a native New Yorker, I knew the area had alot to offer. The subway stations are nearby on 18th street and 7th and on 23rd street and 7th for those heading to the west side. The M23 cross town bus is also easily accessible for those heading to the East side, and wanting to catch the subway on the East side. Chelsea Lodge felt like home. I hardly spent time in the room except going there late at night to sleep, and it was comfortable and cozy. I had a little reservation at first about the shared bathroom but soon found out I had nothing to worry about, as it was kept clean and I never bumped into anyone waiting for it. Of all the places I've stood in the city, I would say this is by far the best one. It felt like coming home to my own place.

Reviews.Title: “A wonderful place to stay!”
Reviews.Author: speedjacer
Reviews.Content: Wanting to save money, my husband and I booked with the Chelsea Lodge for our 5-day summer honeymoon in NYC, after reading many positive reviews on TripAdvisor.com. I can honestly say it's one of the best decisions we have ever made! We stayed in one of the deluxe suites downstairs (room D1, I believe), and we absolutely loved it. It was like having our own little apartment - we even started calling it "home" in conversation, which just shows how comfortable we were! Unlike the more basic rooms, it had its separate bathroom, which was very nice! It also had an adjustable ceiling fan and window A/C unit, its own phone (with a direct line), free wifi, as well as a small TV with free cable (highly recommend channel 210, which is Cinemax On Demand and has free movies). The room was cleaned daily with the utmost care, and the staff is available as needed, but not in your face bothering you every five seconds like some other hotels. In truth, you're not going to spend much time in your hotel room, since there is always so much to see and do in NYC, so why waste money on something more extravagant than you really need? The neighbourhood is terrific and very central - great for getting around the city! Everyone in Chelsea was very warm and friendly, which gave the neighbourhood a very calm, welcoming feel to it. There are a lot of wonderful restaurants in the area as well, so it was always easy to find something tasty to eat before heading off for the day or when returning in the evening. (Highly recommend Le Grainne Cafe for breakfast, as well as Roy's Pizza and La Bottega for dinner - the Chelsea Wine Cellar is also closeby and has a lot of delicious wines, good prices and will sell you a $1 corkscrew if you're buying a corked bottle and need one. All of these places had excellent staff and service!) Honestly, we have absolutely zero complaints about this hotel and can't wait to visit again!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Great Service, Fantastic Price”
Reviews.Author: twinkly
Reviews.Content: I can't recommend this place enough - I trawled for ages trying to find somewhere that we could afford, and am glad we chose Chelsea Lodge. The rooms are basic and small, and there's a shared toilet (WC), but it's in a fantastic location (I never felt worried about safety etc, and it's walking distance to the Subway as well as some lovely Chelsea/Greenwich attractions/restaurants), was a good price, and the staff were great, fromorganising taxi's for us, to lending us a hairdryer/ironing board/phone charger, etc etc.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, Very Affordable and Located in a Vibrant, Central Area!!”
Reviews.Author: Garnet_Stone
Reviews.Content: I recently spent a wonderful 3 nights at the Chelsea Lodge. Very simple booking process via their website and communication was prompt and courteous. I booked a single occupancy room for $119 USD + tax (total $140). I stayed on the 3rd floor in room 3E. This is a corner room that looks out onto the side of another building; however the neighbouring building is far enough away that I still received a nice amount of natural light. The room layout is quite smart and provided more than enough space for me, my 25â€� suitcase and tons of shopping bags. Housekeeping was on point during the whole stay. A thorough cleaning job, fresh/good quality towels and floors were mopped everyday. I was so happy to find lodging with a private shower & sink at this price point. The shared toilets (2 per floor) were incredibly clean â€“ I felt like I was the first one to use it that day. Didnâ€™t think it was possible but I never had to wait to use the facilities at any point during my stay. Sound insulation between rooms was good. Air conditioning was a godsend and never gave me trouble. Note: for those sensitive to a/c sounds, the one in this room was a little on the loud side. It was fine for me and Iâ€™m a medium sleeper. I am fairly out of shape and survived the 2 flights of stairs quite well. You can always request a room on the main (1st) floor near reception if you think it may be a problem for you. Note: I overheard a guest requesting a room change from the main floor to an upper floor for more privacy â€“ so consider that as well. Access to transit is less than 5 min walk away (up 3 short blocks from 20th St to 23rd St and 8 Ave). You can catch the C & E trains from this subway stop. I came back to the hotel no earlier than 12:30am every night and never experienced a problem or felt uncomfortable walking from the station to the hotel. NYers stay up late and there is always tons of foot traffic. For breakfast, I ate at The Dish which is a very reasonably priced restaurant (try their French toast!!). If you prefer to eat near the hotel at night, there are loads of restaurants open until the wee hours on 8th Ave. Otherwise, just grab your Metrocard and run wild in the city. As a solo female traveller I felt beyond safe in this neighbourhood and will definitely make the Chelsea Lodge my home base for future trips to NYC.

Reviews.Title: “Great value & central location”
Reviews.Author: AlbertDigby
Reviews.Content: I had an enjoyable stay of four nights at Chelsea Lodge in June 2010. The price was good for New York and the location is quite central too â€“ a few doors from the 8th Avenue subway. I booked and paid a deposit via email from Australia. This and check-in on arrival went smoothly. Plenty of services and shops around the corner on 8th Avenue â€“ two coin laundries and a Gristedeâ€™s supermarket (good for milk, snacks, light meals, breakfast cereal and so on). There is a RiteAid pharmacy on the corner â€“ drinks and snacks available there too. The HighLine Park is a short walk down 20th Street. I had one of the standard rooms; these are quite small but as a solo traveller it was fine. The double bed was comfortable; it was re-made every day and fresh towels left. Decent toiletries are supplied. There is a shower in the room but a shared toilet in the hall. Even though the toilet was outside my room I rarely heard it being used; it was always clean and fresh. There is not much space for luggage storage; for two people it would be a squeeze. There is one chair but no desk for using a laptop. Thereâ€™s a good free wi-fi service too. The room had an effective air-conditioner and as it was the middle of summer this had to run the whole time I was in the room otherwise it was stuffy. The aircon is right next to your head at night and itâ€™s a fairly noisy hole-in-the-wall model. I wore earplugs to block out the sound. Iâ€™ll be recommending Chelsea Lodge to relatives who are planning a NY holiday next year. I spent a lot of time trying to get something better value on Priceline and eventually gave up. Chelsea Lodge is great value for New York.

Reviews.Title: “Great solution to stay in NY at an affordable price”
Reviews.Author: TrueBlueParis
Reviews.Content: I spent a night in Chelsea Lodge on July 11. I went to NY for professional reasons and extended my trip to visit the city : this was the hotel I chose, based on price and customer feedback and I must say my experience was very close to expected. The hotel is clean. I had asked for a quiet room when booking and enjoyed indeed a room on the garden and at the end of the corridor. I suspect you can very clearly hear people when talking in the corridor however i was so tired by my plane trip + jet lag that I just crashed at 8 PM and slept like a baby. The bed was comfy also. The personnel is not very friendly on the upfront - however I did find that whenever I had a request to make they were very helpful and charming. So don't hesitate to break the ice ! The room is very small. A double bed, a shower and a sink, and you can't really move around. It was perfect for me travelling alone and staying just one night, honestly I didn't need more. I would however consider this if I were travelling as a couple and staying a while (not really many places to put your stuff, and you can't really move around the room). However for me was perfect, once again. ... Ok the sink was a bit shabby, ok the shower was a bit rusty on the outside, but honestly the bed and general state of the room was super clean and much better than I could have anticipated for the price. Really good price for value. Also very convenient the subway and shop around the corner. So all in all, reco for those of you who travel on personal expenses. Would chose better if my company paid :-)

Reviews.Title: “ideal place to come back to at night”
Reviews.Author: Barbara_J4575
Reviews.Content: We didn't intend spending much time in our room during our 8 night stay. We found our room (2nd floor front) clean every day, ideal for two with the shower and sink and a comfy bed which is all we used the room for really. Places to eat very close with a couple of good little deli's for our morning tea and granoly fruit & yoghurt. Can't recommend somewhere for an early breakfast meal as we didn't find anywhere.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay”
Reviews.Author: Lizzle7
Reviews.Content: Great value hotel on a quiet street in Chelsea, nice restaurants in the area. Rooms were clean and we had no problems with the size. Had a ground floor street facing room and had no issues with street noise (although we were quite jet lagged). Good location a couple of minutes walk from the subway, and a nice stroll towards Madison Square Garden / Empire State Building. Only one small critique... we asked for them to recommend a good Italian, and they simply pointed us in the direction of a street where there were a few, rather than a particular place. Obviously if you're after facilities in a hotel then this is not the place for you, but for us it was perfect.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay (especially if you like ducks)”
Reviews.Author: 4MR
Reviews.Content: Location is brilliant - really quiet gorgeous brownstone street but within 10mins walk of meatpacking district, west village and bang in the middle of chelsea. Rooms are charming and not as small as some in New York - immaculate and characterful. Shower in the room takes a bit of getting used to but shared toilets not a problem. Walls are a bit thin and you might get disturned by other residents so best to ask for a room on upper floor if possible but not a major problem. The rates are good for the location and general 'niceness' of the hotel but are not bargain basement cheap which is probably a good thing!

Reviews.Title: “Great value, nice neighborhood”
Reviews.Author: kdenelle
Reviews.Content: This is the second time my husband and I stayed here and we were pretty happy with the experience. We stayed on the first floor and had a shared toilet (shower and sink in our room). The room was cozy but the bed was a bit too soft and we found several hairs on the sheets (probably from the housekeeper) when we pulled back the covers. The shared bathroom on the first floor is very small. I didn't have a problem with it but my husband said his knees touched the door when he sat down (he's 5' 11"). We really like staying here, we like the neighborhood and it's pretty central to all that we like to see/do in NYC.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect place for an individual to stay”
Reviews.Author: agehamil
Reviews.Content: I chose the Chelsea Lodge mostly for the price because I was only going to be in NYC one night and just wanted a safe and comfortable place to sleep. I was given a room on the third floor which faced the back of the hotel. The hotel will not guarantee you a specific room but I think it is important to note that my room faced the back because I heard no noise from the street when I went to sleep at night or in the morning. This may not be the case if your room faces the front. The hotel gave me a key to my room and to the front door of the brownstone so I could come and go as I pleased. It felt like coming home at the end of the night. The room had a double bed which was very comfortable for one. I dont know if you book a double if the bed is any bigger. It would have been tight to share that bed with my husband. The room had an open closet for hanging clothes, a dresser, a TV which I never watched, a small desk, a double bed, a small chair, a sink and a shower. The shower had good water pressure and lots of hot water. The room did not get wet when I used the shower as has happened in some hotels I have stayed in. The one thing I felt was missing from the room was a full length mirror (could be put on the back of the door). It would have been nice to help with getting ready to go out. The location of the hotel is ideal. Quick walk to the Village and Midtown. Great access to subways and you can always hop in a cab. The neighborhood has lots of great restaurants and bars and there were lots of people out and about late at night. The hotel is on a treelined side street though so it is quieter. I would definitely recommend this hotel but the rooms ARE small so if two friends are travelling together it woud be best to each get their own room.

Reviews.Title: “My Favorite Place to Stay in NYC”
Reviews.Author: skecanj
Reviews.Content: You have to practically be an insider to know this hotel is there -- not very well marked. But actually I liked that, because I felt like I was living in the City, not just staying in some regular hotel. I loved coming "home" in the evening, walking down a few steps, using my key just as if it were my studio apartment in NY. There's a market close by if you need groceries. I've stayed in both of the suites, plus in one room. If you can swing it, definitely get a suite (next door to Chelsea Lodge are the Chelsea Lodge Suites). Very spacious, absolutely lovely garden in back. Perfect for a longer stay (but I stay in a suite no matter how long I'm staying in NY). If you stay in the hotel, ask for a room downstairs with a bath. Rooms are small but clean and totally adequate for a NYC visit. Besides, you aren't going to be spending much time in your hotel when you're in NYC -- at least I would hope. For more info and a longer review, go here http://www.associatedcontent.com/article/1730362/chelsea_lodge_and_chelsea_lodge_suites.html?cat=16

Reviews.Title: “great value for your money in new york city”
Reviews.Author: bananaboats999
Reviews.Content: I booked a week stay here for myself and my daughter mid April. We arrived late in the evening and fell into bed exhausted. Unfortunately, I didn't get much sleep that night between the street noise, the early morning garbage trucks, and the automated heating system which came on and turned the room into a sweltering hell. I was miserable, and not looking forward to the rest of my stay. Fortunately, when I requested a quieter room, there was one available for us. We ended up in a tinier room in the back, which my daughter didn't like, but which I appriciated due to my light sleeping habits. There was next to no natural light in the room, which for some people might make getting ready for going out tricky, but we checked our makeup in the hallway under the skylight so it was no big deal. The shared bathrooms were always very clean, which we appreciated. Sometimes other patrons using the facilities in the middle of the night jarred me out of my sleep, but of course if you're not a light sleeper it probably wouldn't matter to you. The housekeeping service provided clean towels daily. The room didn't bother me as much as it did my daughter, I never expected it to be large or light. I came to New York to spend time outside of my room, and I liked coming "home" to our little room and taking a hot shower and getting into the comfy bed and sleeping in a QUIET room. The staff were extremely helpful, taking time to look through subway maps or on the internet when we needed information about anything. A button popped off my jacket before I was heading out the door and the deskperson located thread and a needle so I could do a quick repair. They ordered a car service for us to take us to the airport and were always available to answer any concerns. Dragging heavy bags up and down two flights of stairs wasn't too easy for me, but the person who greeted us the first night assisted me with my bags. If you are looking for very basic lodgings in a convienent neighborhood, close to the subway etc. with friendly staff ON A BUDGET, then this would be a great bet. I would stay again, but I would bring earplugs!

Reviews.Title: “Little gem in the Chelsea area”
Reviews.Author: thrahtobe
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Chelsea Lodge back in Oct/Nov 2009. We had a brilliant stay, staff made us feel welcome and lend us some essential stuff like iron and hairdryer. Even though the rooms are small there is just enough room for 2 people, the shared toilets were not a problem either. One tip we ate a few times at Le Grainne cafe which is on 9th Avenue 21st. Lovely little gem and we never had a bad meal. Overall i would recommend Chelsea Lodge to people on a budget.

Reviews.Title: “Cosy hotel in great neighbourhood”
Reviews.Author: Zzuzy
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I stayed in the Chelsea Lodge Hotel from December 28th until January 4th (7 nights). We really liked the hotel! It feels like home in Chelsea Lodge, and it is located in a great neighbourhood. Not too busy, but in a few minutes metro you are at Times Square. The rooms are a bit small but that doesn't matter. They are cleaned every day, the restrooms down the hall didn't feel like we shared them. They were clean and never occupied. Only minus point is the bed (a bit small (both width and length) and wobbling). We can recommend to eat at Spice (Thai restaurant) at 9th ave, just around the corner (2 locations). And breakfast at 's Nice, when you walk at 9ave, about 14th street at your right hand. Next time I would go to Chelsea Lodge again!

Reviews.Title: “Amazing stay, friendly staff and excellent location”
Reviews.Author: AliceSheff86
Reviews.Content: I loved my stay at Chelsea Lodge, the staff were really helpful and friendly and the area made me feel safe. I didnt realise how close we were to Times Square, when it was a nice day we happily walked in. But the subway is on 23rd street and on on 18th, so getting places was quick and easy. A nice restaurant round the corner is Elmo, good atmosphere and nice food. I really dont think you could get a better value hotel for the area, i would recommend this hotel to everyone i know. Only slight complaint is the radiator, which was SO noisy, it kept us awake some nights. We were in room 3A and it was a nice size, not massive but i wouldnt say it was small either.Decorated with style and comfort in mind, it was lovely! When we go back to NY we will be staying in Chelsea Lodge!

Reviews.Title: “Great value in a great neighborhood”
Reviews.Author: Issy76
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for four nights. The room was always clean and we never had a problem with the shared bathrooms. The area the hotel is in feels very safe at all hours and is very convenient for the subway. I've always stayed near Times Square in past visits, but much prefer the "neighborhood" experience of Chelsea Lodge and will stay here again. I don't think I could have found a better value in NYC.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, small, friendly and good value”
Reviews.Author: MrKiez
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the hotel for 5 nights. Had a room on the first floor, next to the toilet. The toilets and the room are super clean. The rooms are small, as we didn't spend a whole lot of time in our room that wasn't a problem. The staf was helpfull, they booked us a cab back to the airport. If we plan to go back to NYC we are staying here again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Garden Suite”
Reviews.Author: PenkiArnhem
Reviews.Content: I stayed in the (upstairs) Garden Suite. As mentioned in a previous review, the maids did make up the bed and did clean the bathroom, but they did not sweep the floor. It was not even clean when I arrived. It was nice to have a private garden, however. If you're looking for your own private place, this is the one because the suites are not in the same building as the hotel. There is no reception. The A/C's are rather noisy for light sleepers but this is NYC......

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Choice for the budget traveller”
Reviews.Author: Hannah W
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for my partner's birthday and received very good care and service from the hotel staff (including lending of an umbrella when it was pouring with rain and good recommendations for breakfast and dinner). We were in room 2A, which was small, but to be honest was everything we needed. It really felt more like a NYC apartment experience rather than a hotel (much more fun!) and was very easy distance to 23rd street subway stop, which we used a lot. Also only 14 blocks from Penn station (about a 20 minute walk, with a suitcase!). If anyone is a little concerned to see I rated a litte less on the 'cleanliness' this was simply because the floor of our room was a bit dusty, but honestly didn't detract from our experience! Best things: Comfortable bed, friendliness of staff and guests, being able to see Empire State Building every time you ventured out in the morning! Worst thing: Could be a little noisy (creaky floorboards, central heating, people on stairs and landing) but we were so exhausted from sightseeing every day it wasn't enough to disturb our sleep.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value for NY - but SMAAAAAALL.”
Reviews.Author: cadi_cunha
Reviews.Content: If youÂ´re not bothererd by the fact that the toilet is outside the room and shared with a few other guests from your floor, itÂ´s not an issue. If youÂ´re on your own in the cuty and have few luggages, it wonÂ´t be a problem either. After being to NYC many times, thereÂ´s no need to stay in midtown anymore... which makes the hotel location perfect. ItÂ´s a very charming place and the owner is a really sweet person, always with a smile on his face. ItÂ´s spotless and housekeeping does a really nice work. The room is cozy, but too small, and the tiny window makes it a bit claustrophobic... Anyway - paying $150 with taxes to be that well located in Manhattan is sometimes worth it.

Reviews.Title: “Fine and dandy once again!”
Reviews.Author: Markymoke
Reviews.Content: This was my 4th visit to Chelsea Lodge in 3 year and they have never let me down. Paul and his staff are helpful and the location is great for all the action that NYC has to offer.

Reviews.Title: “clean, good value, nice location, quiet - but feel slightly cheated”
Reviews.Author: Cassiu5
Reviews.Content: The Chelsea Lodge Hotel is clean and excellent value. I doubt my brother and I could have got separate rooms at this price anywhere else in the Centre of New York. The location meant easy travelling on the subway, which we managed many times a day without any trouble. There are also excellent restaurants and cafes within easy walking distance and a small convenience store right on the street corner. The HighLine is also only a 5 minute walk away, which I recommend for early morning strolls However - we booked our rooms 10 months in advance, when we arrived the receptionist huffed and puffed at the seeming inconvenience of having to book us in. He then stated that one of our rooms had to be a single room since all the other rooms were fully booked. This soured my stay. I am 6 foot and not best suited to a single bed. The bed was also on wheels which meant that if I tried to sit up in bed it would move across the floor Their website clearly states that all rooms have a double bed - this is obviously untrue. I know I should have said something at the time. I will email them my concerns and let them know of my disappointment Despite this, I would stay here again and I do recommend it, the price is so good. Just make sure you get what you ask for

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for the Price!”
Reviews.Author: midwestrlvr
Reviews.Content: We couldn't have asked for a better place! After our hostel "lost" our reservation just 4 days before our departure we were scrambling to find something in our budget in a safe neighborhood. I emailed the Chelsea Lodge and with one room left I booked it. The owners were so incredibly nice and helpful, let me print my boarding passes so I wouldn't have to go to an internet cafe, and were wonderful with directions and suggestions. Yes, the rooms are tiny, but who goes to NYC to hang out in a hotel room? Our room was on the second floor and on Saturday night there was quite a lot of street noise, but the weekday nights were nice and quiet. we shared a bathroom and I never saw another person using it, or in the hallways for that matter. It was like we had the place to ourselves. The neighborhood was fantastic. Within walking distance are restaurants and shops and the subway is at 14th and 23rd.

Reviews.Title: “Chelsea Suites -- Garden Apartment Warning”
Reviews.Author: SurfmanSD
Reviews.Content: As a former New Yorker, I like staying in apartments and the Chelsea Suites, a few doors down from the Chelsea Lodge seemed a good option rather than a vacation rental off Criagslist. I wanted the daily room service. I was disappointed to find that my "Garden Suite" was not the same Garden Suite on the website, but actually a smaller apartment, with low ceilings beneath the web site room -- which which has high ceilings, large windows and is the same price. When I complained to the young woman at the front desk she did not apologize for the "bait and switch" and said the other room was booked for the same week I was there. Make sure you get the upstairs Garden Suite if you decide to stay here. And be nice to the tenant below and walk softly. Those upstairs tenants woke me up every morning clomping around on the hard wood floors. The maids did make the bed and clean the bathroom, but they never swept the floor. By the end of the week it was littered with leaves from the garden and the usual dirt. The halls had old wallpaper with dirty carpeting and overall it was a little depressing. The bed was hard and felt like cardboard under the paper thin sheets. The quilt bedspread was worn, faded and looked dirty. But it was lovely to lay in my bed and look out on the verdant, private garden with a nice tree which had changed it's leaves to gold. It's hard to find this kind of garden apartment on a pretty chelsea street at this price and for that reason alone, I'd consider going back. But I'm going to look closer at the Craigslist vacation rental apartments first -- which are half the price.

Reviews.Title: “great value”
Reviews.Author: Jetlaggedbuthappy
Reviews.Content: fantastic value guesthouse. It's so cheap we were a little anxious but it came highly recommended. We did find our room at the front of the hotel on the ground floor a little noisy and though we were prepared for the shared toilet, we weren't prepared for walking across reception to get to it. I would recommend requesting a room on the upper floors or one at the back.

Reviews.Title: “small, but nice”
Reviews.Author: smitchell522
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for a few nights on our honeymoon. The staff we dealt with was pleasant, and they let us keep our luggage in the office the day we were leaving since we were leaving after check out time. I don't know if all of the rooms come with a private bathroom, but we were kind of in the basement and we had a private bathroom. Everything was clean and there was a window AC unit in the room. It was a good price for New York, so we didn't mind the small room and bathroom. We also wanted somewhere 'with character' that wasn't a chain hotel, so this was perfect. The neighborhood seemed safe, and it was quiet at night. I think the area is popular with the gay crowd because we saw lots of gay couples while we were there. The hotel is only a couple short blocks to a subway stop, which was very convenient. Overall, we enjoyed are stay!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect! Highly recommended!”
Reviews.Author: pp_2008
Reviews.Content: We are a newly married couple from Germany. We were in NY for the first time. We stayed in Chelsea Lodge for 5 days/ nights and did absolutely enjoy our stay there. Our room was small but very cute and, especially, very clean. Sink and shower were in the room, 2 bathrooms just next door.The restrooms have always been clean and we never had to wait for one as there were enough of them. The stuff was very friendly and helpful; room service was great: fresh towels every day, only could the floor have been vacumed once or twice. Chelsea was very nice to stay; a very nice and especially quite part of NY city. Grocery stores, drugstores, delis, restaurant and metro stations are all just around the corner. All in all: If we wil ever be in NY again, we would definitely stay at Chelsea Lodge again!!!

Reviews.Title: “Fulfilled its purpose”
Reviews.Author: pojaya
Reviews.Content: Loved its location in Chelsea area of Manhattan. Easy walk to the subway stations, as well as the shops, restaurants, etc. Chelsea market was a bit of a disappointment though,as far as markets go. Just as well it is very close to this hotel, otherwise I would be a little upset if I had made my way all the way there from midtown/ uptown. Stayed in a room on the top floor. The stairs are steep, and creaks a lot! No issues with the shared toilets, which were kept fairly clean. Room was quite small, but not the worst I have seen. The in room shower was a bit awkward to use. Next time, will probably pay more to stay somewhere more comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Very Small Rooms but Great Location in Chelsea”
Reviews.Author: biggles81
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 6 nights total either side of a bus trip out of New York. Great base for exploring the Big Apple. The Lodge is a converted brownstone on 20th St between 8th and 9th Avenue. Rooms and small but quite comfortable. Small shower / wash basin and shared bathroom in hall outside. We had the room downstairs, next to the door first night and a 1st floor room that was much quieter for our other 5 nights. Room was clean and serviced daily. Very helpful staff on hand. Location 50m from numerous restaurants in Chelsea's GBLT district. Very reasonably priced for New York accommodation.

Reviews.Title: “Would definitely stay again though it could have been better!”
Reviews.Author: kiltyblue
Reviews.Content: Stayed in one of the basement flats, had requested a garden flat however was given street facing one, this was a bit confusing because it had initially been confirmed but then was unavailable. Guy at reception who was dealing with this was not particularly helpful or apologetic about this. Room was very spacious, air conditioned and had all amenities required. Had a charming kind of feel to it and decor was reasonable. Due to street facing, however was very noisy at all hours of day and night and as below street level was a bit dull even during the day. Daily room service was good and to a high standard. Good shower and excellent wardrobe space. Surprised at low level of security on flat door, only small lock- the push in button kind. Security into the building however was better with at least two doors to get through. Location was amazing, only a couple of blocks to the subway and the neighbourhood felt very safe. Beautiful tree lined street, very friendly area with good selection of restaurants and bars close by. Overall i would recommend a stay here, mainly due to space and location

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely lovely place in a great location”
Reviews.Author: northernbynature
Reviews.Content: I can only repeat what other reviewers have said: good value for money, safe area, close to subway and interesting areas - you do feel like a local staying in a place like this! Yes, the rooms are small, but lovingly decorated and have everything you need (maybe bar a bit more wardrobe space) if you are mostly spending your time out and about, which I suppose which you are bound to in NY. Sharing the toilet was no problem whatsoever, hardly saw or heard anyone else, shower worked perfectly, bed was comfy. As someone else said, a light over the sink would be helpful, but otherwise no complaints. Friendly staff who helped carrying luggage upstairs. Would definitely come back to stay here!!!

Reviews.Title: “I loved the Chelsea Lodge and want to go back!!”
Reviews.Author: christinemacca
Reviews.Content: At first I wasn't sure I was in the right place as there was no sign. As soon as I stepped in, I loved it. Lovely little hallway which had a olde worlde feel to it. I loved the pictures on the wall and the green painted bannister. No lift but the lovely guy in the reception room (sorry didn't catch the name) helped us with our bags. We were on the top floor and looked onto 20th Street, which was lovely and leafy. Room quite small but I didn't find it a problem and we had everything we needed and hardly spent any time in it. I was a bit apprehensive at first about sharing a toilet but it was no problem whatsoever. There were 2 very clean toilets on each floor, and I didn't once see or even hear anyone else in them. In a great location between 7th and 8th avenue, and and only a few streets from the subway. I'd recommend this to anyone and will stay there again if i'm lucky enough to visit New York again.

Reviews.Title: “I hesitate to Let folks know what a great palce this is”
Reviews.Author: RangerDanS
Reviews.Content: In honor of beat Author, Jack Kerouac, and other adventurers. I would be happy to give this resting place a horrible review in order to save it for myself- but, then, that would not be fair. Rooms are small, we call them â€œmodestâ€� and there is no elevator. But if your purpose is to have a comfortable place to rest between city adventures, whether theatre, literature, music, or just walking around, this is a great resting place. The nearby breakfast bistro is not small reason to stay here as well. Who does not need an excellent cafÃ©â€™ in the morning. But, did I say it was nice? Nay- it is horrible- and we will enslave ourselves to it often.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location and Good Value”
Reviews.Author: Whadders
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a lovely leafy street just off 8th Avenue, is is close to the 23rd Street Subway which is useful for the E line which connects direct to JFK plus all the other lines. The area feels safe day and night and has some good bars and resutrants nearby although some do close early compared to NYC standards. There is a supermarket on the corner and a couple of Starbucks nearby. The hotel is very nice although I did feel the rooms were a little small once you opened up the large suticase it was all a little tight, a light over the mirror by the sink would also be useful. However we did not spend much time in the hotel and the bed was comfy, a reminder to other guests that closing doors can be done quietly! It is within walking distance of several of the main attractions or areas.

Reviews.Title: “Once Again the Chelsea Lodge live up to its reputation!”
Reviews.Author: fraggles1975
Reviews.Content: This was our 2nd stay at the Chelsea Lodge (18 months later) and once again we were made very welcome and the rooms were very cozy and warm. Thanks again Chelsea Lodge for making us feel at home!

Reviews.Title: “Great value, good staff, good room, but noisy cleaners”
Reviews.Author: MonkeyDave
Reviews.Content: We stayed here a couple of years ago in one of the delux rooms downstairs, which we really liked. This time, we were in the room next door (DR2, I think?), which was a bit smaller, but equally as pleasant. As with the last stay, it was all great, except this time the room was right next to the cleaners' room. Which meant that, every morning at about 7am, we would be woken up by the cleaners clattering around and calling loudly to each other. The owner of the place would sometimes wander around singing loudly around this sort of time, too. This is a minor gripe, though, as we probably would have chosen to wake up not too much later, but it was a little annoying. Everything else about the hotel was fine. I'd definitely try breakfast at Murray's Bagels on 8th Ave between 22nd and 23rd St. The best bagels I've ever had by a mile, we went there for breakfast almost every day.

Reviews.Title: “Highly recommended”
Reviews.Author: milboj
Reviews.Content: My husband and I are two 25 year olds and it was our first time in NYC. If you want a hotel, do not stay here! It's a wonderful home away from home instead. We stayed for 10 nights and wanted a place to sleep, without bell boys running after us and cheesy greetings every time we show our faces out of our room. The staff are friendly when you ask for advise and are prompt to pass on all phone messages. Fresh towels and a quick wipe down of the sink are provided daily, but we would have appreciated a change of linen at least once, as well as a sweep of the floor, which was fairly dusty by the time we left.. but not to worry. The shared toilet is no problem at all, it was always free and always clean. Chelsea is a wonderful area, and the E train which goes both up and down town is only a 5 minute walk away, as is Murray's Bagels, which was frequented by us daily. Great value for money - highly recommended if you want a fuss free place to stay. The only cons I have to mention is poor internet signal inside the room on the 3rd floor (had to sit on the steps to use it) and a very average, squeaky bed.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, good value”
Reviews.Author: Lizzipoo
Reviews.Content: Just got back from a weeklong stay herea room for two with shared loo was $150 including all taxes - cheap for NYC. Chose the Chelsea Lodge as we wanted to be able to save a little on accommodation to enable us to spend on eating out. Having read previous reviews, we knew the room would be small, so were not surprised by this. However, it was adequate for our needs, and was cleaned daily, with freshly laundred towels. There was a plentiful supply of hot water and the pressure in the shower was good. There were two loos to share on each of the floors and I found that there was always one free and they were very clean. Our room was at the back of the building, which I was pleased about, as it was further away from the loos and any associated noise in the night. Staff kept themselves to themselves, but were polite and helpful when asked for advice. There is WiFi access. The location was great - this section of W20th Street is between 8th and 9th Avenues and there are lots of restaurants/upmarket delis in the vicinity, but a 15 min walk will get you to Union Square, or the West Village. 3 subway stations within a five minute walk: 18th/7th for lines 1,2 and 3; 23rd/8th for lines C and E and 14th/8th for lines A,C, E and L.

Reviews.Title: “Bed without breakfast”
Reviews.Author: Abbeyreviewer
Reviews.Content: The Chelsea Lodge was easy to find. There was no breakfast provided, however there was plenty of choice locally and we found a healthy smoothie for breakfast just around the corner. There is an entrance to the tube at 23rd Street a 5 minute walk away and the Chelsea Lodge is well placed for exploring Manhattan. The shared toilet was cleaned every day and it was never a problem sharing as we had a basin and shower in the room. The room was very small and the Lodge was run by a young girl who was friendly but typically of New York there was little by way of introduction or explanation.

Reviews.Title: “A home away from home!”
Reviews.Author: Deano1975
Reviews.Content: My partner and I always stay at the Chelsea Lodge when we visit NYC. We stay in a suite, usually a garden suite, and as soon as we arrive we settle back into life in the Big Apple. This place is so homely and cosy and is so comfortable. Okay the facilities aren't always the best but we always feel so relaxed and safe when staying here. The staff are friendly and helpful but best of all they leave you alone to enjoy your trip.
